intro: Empogona acidophylla, commonly known as the sour leaf vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish fruits that are edible but have a tart flavor. Its botanical features include hairy stems and opposite leaf arrangement. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
